website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight option that offers a lot in terms of features and can also easily be mounted on a wall or arm stand.
pros: 24-inch display has 1920-by-1080p resolution and a quick response time
Has HDMI, VGA, and DVI-D inputs
Is VESA mountable, so you can easily hang it on a wall
Six preset video modes include Game, Night View, and Theater
cons: Some quality issues have been reported that include ghosting, flickering, and dead pixels
Some buyers felt they couldn't fine-tune the brightness as well as they wished

customer_reviews.title: Oh so nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned multiple ASUS monitors for a little over ten years now. I am largely brand loyal because of the build quality on the models I've used. My latest acquisition, two 24" ASUS VS248H-P monitors, replaced my single VE278Q. I'm not a high-end gamer and don't need a 144Hz beast. However, I do need lots of real estate to comfortable work in Visio and simultaneously flip through a zillion Chrome tabs. The monitors have only been up for a few hours, but I'm finding it very easy to keep everything in sight. I'm very pleased with my purchase and will continue to buy ASUS monitors in the future!
customer_reviews.author: KARL LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: P.E.R.F.E.C.T.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is one of my favorite electronic purchases I've gotten in the last year or two, the 24" size is great to sit in front of and it's perfect for Xbox/PC gaming (or any console). Everything looks fantastic in 1080p on this monitor and I use it daily - never had any issues so far. It was also fairly easy to calibrate, the out of box calibrations were good, and I used some tools to sharpen everything a bit (everything is SO clear and the colors POP!). I absolutely love it and the 1ms response time is great for online gaming. Will continue to use this brand for any monitors I need.
customer_reviews.author: WASTELAND RAVENTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Get busy buying!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to make my stay at home office more functional. I was amazed that even thought the models were slightly different and my original Asus is three years older. The two match perfectly (Left VS247 & Right VS248 ). Color, brightness, contrast. Everything I loved about the first monitor is still present in this one. What a beautiful monitor at a sweet price point. I have searched and there is not one dead pixel, I can’t see any edge lighting, or flash lighting in the corners. This monitor is my new best friend...remember i now have to work from home. I miss my friends, but this monitor does shine some Andy Dufresne light onto my drab world...
customer_reviews.author: E. Heilner

customer_reviews.title: color changes, have to turn off and on
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the computer a lot for business, and I bought two of these. I love them, but one of them has turned out to be slightly defective. The color fades to strange colors on one of them occasionally, and I have to reboot it to clear it up. I'm concerned that this indicates something that may prematurely fail. I live abroad, and it's hard to get things, very hard to return them, and thus there is no option for me, realistically, other than to wait for it to fail and get an other pair. Other than that defect, these are great monitors. If you live where you could return one if this happens, I'd recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Garber

customer_reviews.title: NOT Vesa on 24in model, Correction
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some people saying this is Vesa and others saying it's not. I have the 24in monitor and it is NOT vesa compatible. There are 4 dimples in the back of the monitor where the screws should go, but there just plastic dimples. no where for the screws to go. Correction: It is Vesa. those plastic dimples were actually rubber dimples. I'm not sure how your supposed to get them out, but i used a drill with a small drill bit and it sucked them out to reveal the threading for the vesa mount.
customer_reviews.author: Ruston

customer_reviews.title: Hazy when compared to another IPS screen
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 ASUS PA248Q's which are AMAZING, however I am trying out video capture devices, all of which accept a max resolution of 1080p. The PA248Q's get fuzzy and stretched at that resolution so I was looking for a similar screen at a lower resolution. This screen is great and works, however there is a blurry/smudged/greyed look to it compared to the PA248Q which ruins color quality. I am currently looking to replace this with a better color quality monitor. UPDATE: Through color calibration and some graphics card software settings I have managed to get the colors to not be so bad. It still doesn't look as good as the PA248Q, but better than the picture shows.
customer_reviews.author: Luticman

customer_reviews.title: Text is illegible
customer_reviews.text: Like a few other reviewers, I could not get text too look sharp enough to be acceptable, whatever the settings. I tried adjusting the monitor's settings, re-installing video drivers, adjusting ClearType and all sorts of things to no avail. If you're going to do any kind of work that involves reading some text, this monitor is going to suck. This is unacceptable. I ordered a Dell P2314H as a replacement and the issue was gone so that tells me the problem indeed came from the monitor itself. Now I don't know whether mine was faulty or they all display this problem but whatever it is, buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: TalmabuK

customer_reviews.title: Budget screen, nothing to write home about
customer_reviews.text: I'd concider this a budget monitor good for general use. I wouldn't concider this a gaming screen based on my experience with this monitor. Bezel is thicker than it needs to be in my opinion, and picture quality is passable. I use it for a second screen on my laptop, but I'll use it for word processing while reserving my main screen for video/YouTube/graphics work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy c

customer_reviews.title: Didnt even work!
customer_reviews.text: I waited almost 3 weeks for this thing - I put together the stand and plugged it in - when I turned it on, it would just flicker on and then go dark and the 'on' light would turn orange. I tried to plug into my computer with an HDMI and that didnt do anything- SO disappointed. I really need this thing for work and now I am stuck waiting for another one. AVOID. Companies which do not do a quality check on their products before packaging are a HUGE disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Brittini Callies

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.  About the best out there at this price and size!
customer_reviews.text: One of the BEST monitors out there! Just perfect standard quality. The colors are the best in this monitor, even over some other ASUS monitors. You will never be disappointed with this one! Plus, you get all three major connectors for the mutli-monitor set ups that you need. This monitor, out of the box. is about as true on your colors as I have known. Red is red, and white is white, etc... As with any monitor, you can get a dead pixel here and there, but I own, and have installed for others, many of these and have never seen a dead pixel in one yet! That could just be my luck, but I don't believe in coincidence.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: 3 defective monitors out of 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 and it was working good. Then I bought another and it lasted 5 minutes before the display quit showing a signal. So I returned an got another. Same thing, so then I just ordered a different brand and that is working fine. Now the 1st one I bought quit working. Maybe I am massively unlucky to get 3 bad monitors, but I have never had such problems.
customer_reviews.author: Fargo Dude

customer_reviews.title: Too bright
customer_reviews.text: I found the display brightness to be too much and have it dialed down ALL THE WAY to zero using the menu. Colors are a bit off too (dialed down BLUE intensity for some warmth) but I can live with it. Had to tinker to get the computer and monitor display in sync also. I use the VGA port interface. My old monitor (Sceptre) had better color but it bit the dust. At this point, I have the color and brightness set at tolerable levels, but I also miss my old monitor. Instructions on how to make adjustments are poor. I can live with this though.
customer_reviews.author: DeRavenSey

customer_reviews.title: Uses VGA and not HDMI but all in all a great monitor for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my 3rd monitor and it does its job swimmingly. A little down to find out that it comes with a VGA cable and not an HDMI. I forget but I'm not sure if it even has an HDMI input. The picture quality is about average and the colors are decent but for the price point I don't think you can get much better.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Parker Ramey

customer_reviews.title: Awesomtime stinks
customer_reviews.text: Bought a refurb from awsometime , trieed 3 differnt plugs none worked , they wouldnt take it back
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Great for mounting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my desk at work along withto mount the monitors. The monitor and stand install together quickly and perfectly. Only took a few minutes to set up. The monitors come with all the required cords (like they should) and I only needed a screwdriver to remove the desk stand from the monitor prior to mounting on the dual stand. Works great, I may never go back to setting a monitor on my desk again!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but terrible cable
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor but bad cable. When you buy this monitor, I recommend that you also upgrade to a better cable, such as the one found here:  The cable that came with the monitor lasted only a short time. It is small and quite inadequate. With the horrid colors, I originally thought something was wrong with the monitor, but the new cable solved the problem. So don't discard the monitor if you have color trouble -- just upgrade your cable. One would have thought ASUS would know better than to skimp on the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Mini office setup acceptable
customer_reviews.text: This is used for my mini office setup where I do shool. So far I have had no issues with this product. I do not think it is a higher-end product maybe for people who would like to game, but that is not what I do on my computer so it suites me just fine. Delivery and packaging were absolutely on target. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: G.M

customer_reviews.title: Seems great to me -- requires actual performing 4K HDMI cables
customer_reviews.text: Works well with great image. I am not a wizard at graphics quality or other subtle aspects like video lag. I give it 4 stars since I spent way too much money trying to figure out what was wrong with adding this screen to an existing system and getting "no signal" errors. The problem wasn't "no signal". The problem was signal being messed up by a bogus gold plated "4K ready" cable. I got a real 4K or HMDI 2.0b cable and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: R. N.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Please removed the covers for the VESA mount. Many people say it doesn't have VESA holes, but indeed it does. They are located under covers. I believe it is to protect the hole from dirt during packaging and transport. Works well. Very good screen.
customer_reviews.author: xAgyex

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor for the money, solidly built, components decent quality. This was a replacement for another at a similar price but was superior in every way for the extra $15. The other had to go back and that’s not something one wants to do in April 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brunel

customer_reviews.title: NOT VESA compatible!
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 of these.. and as the picture shows NO VESA mounting retainers were inserted in the product! Even though is cliams VESA and shows them installed in the picture. This was a recommended monitor for the stand I bought.. don't follow Amazon's recommend monitor it will NOT work with a VESA mount.
customer_reviews.author: sauralf

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor 4 years later
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2016 and it’s still going strong in 2020. Clear picture. Use it for work and internet browsing. I’ve been taking it back and forth with me to work from home at a friends house and haven’t had any dead pixels yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Dale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color, contrast, build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality display for this price range. Solid color reproduction, contrast, and brightness; the image on my older Acer monitor looks sickly when side-by-side with this one. I calibrated this monitor with a Spyder4 Pro and it looks fantastic (see Spyder analysis below). Plus, it's a matte screen, no horrible glare. Response time is perfect - I never see any ghosting or artifacts. Build quality is good; I don't have any issues with the stand. I'd strongly recommend for any gamer or visual media enthusiast who is looking for a solid monitor but doesn't need a $400+ professional display. Spyder 4 Pro analysis of the VS248H-P: 98% of sRGB 76% of AdobeRGB Measured Display Gamma: 2.2 (0.07)
customer_reviews.author: K. F.Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: The quality does not look "HD" at all and I'm overall annoyed and upset with this product
customer_reviews.text: This monitor had input connection issues with my desktop, a very noticeable yellow tint on every display setting, and dead pixels. The quality does not look "HD" at all and I'm overall annoyed and upset with this product. I don't think I'll ever purchase an Asus ever again. I really shouldn't have relied so heavily on the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: The colors on this monitor are not good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second monitor even though my first one is an Acer. I am returning it due to the color on this monitor being extremely annoying. When using these monitors in a dual setup, this one looks yellow compared to the Acer I originally owned. I googled around and played in the menus for probably an hour adjusting every color setting possible and it still looked like the whole screen had a yellow tint to it. I hope that it's just my display that looks like this and not every one that is shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Claire LeSuer

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor, lousy rebate policy
customer_reviews.text: Decent monitor at a good price. Took a star off for the hoops you have to go through to get the rebate. Then, it got denied because something didn't match up and they wanted me to re-submit the bar-code and something else again to verify the purchase. YOU GOT TO BE KIDDING ME ASUS! I don' think so Lucy! Either give me the rebate you offered with proof of purchase or not. You will need to submit three different doc's to get your coin from them. Sheesh. You know ASUS, this kind of negative PR just frustrates customers. It makes you look bad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2013 and still being used as a second monitor on my setup today in 2020. Picture quality isn’t the greatest, especially sitting beside a much newer model but it’s a great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CHarp

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep HDMI signal.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems with this monitor. I've previously had Dell monitors and never had an issue. I read the reviews before I bought this monitor, and the reviews seemed okay, but I have had nothing but problems. It keeps losing the HDMI signal. I don't think that I should have to unplug the HDMI cord to use my computer. I will never buy another ASUS product again. Just a waste of money --no wonder they have 24/7 support they need it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Computer monitor from ASUS, A Name You Can Trust
customer_reviews.text: I have been building computers since the 286 processor, and down through the years ASUS has emerged as an excellent provider of computer peripherals and equipment. ASUS motherboards are among the best, so are the DVD drives, Video cards, and the monitors. This is a very good monitor at a fair price. We purchased this for our office desktop, and it makes reading data so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Nail

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but bright.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together and hook up, very happy with the size. However I had to take off a star because of it's brightness. I have my desk under a loft bed so it's very dark, and this screen is extremely bright. I turned down the setting to 0 brightness, put it in theater mode, messed with other contrast/saturation/color settings, but it's still a lot brighter than what I'm used to. Maybe once I get lighting under my loft bed it'll make a difference. So basically if you're in a constant dark environment, it will be very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Neo

customer_reviews.title: Worse than VE248, HOT PIXELS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was an upgrade to my current VE248 for a dual monitor display. Several HOT PIXELS just outside of Amazon's 30 day return period and still under manufacturer warranty. Now I'll have to pay for shipping a defective product to get a replacement (or refurbished unit) from ASUS directly. Stick with the tried and true VE248. I have 2 of the VE248 monitors for 5 plus years and no issues, and never a single hot or dead pixel.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: slightly disappointed at color saturation but still a great deal
customer_reviews.text: slightly disappointed in the brightness of the colors on this display. it seems i have to put the display in "game mode" in order to really see anything, but that kind of washes out all of the colors with "whiteness" or brightness. i hope a customer-service person from Asus is reading this and can get back to me. 2015-2-27 update: upgraded from 3 to 4 out of 5 stars because i realized how good this monitor is compared to the rest on the market at this price-range. very sturdy base, and decent image quality for this price. the colors aren't as saturated as my sony 55" TV at 1080p but heck, this is definitely a bargain
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great on my desk, and works nicely for anything from word processing and web browsing to 3D modeling (Blender FTW) to Kerbal Space Program. The colors are a tad washed out for my tastes, but as other reviews have suggested, tinkering with the settings has made it palatable. I also installed F.Lux, which helps as well. Thing is, for the price I feel weird even mentioning it - you really can't beat the value for the price. I'm happy. I've had good luck with Asus in the past, and this unit is no exception. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: They work just fine. The only issue is that they will not ...
customer_reviews.text: We buy several of these monitors as a "second" monitor for our laptop employees. We use Apple laptops so we're using an HDMI to Thunderbolt cable. They work just fine. The only issue is that they will not automatically recognize that the input is HDMI so you have to make the selection via the button on the monitor, and you have to slightly press and hold the button to get the selection mode. Good video quality, decent size, reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have to work from home
customer_reviews.text: A small laptop screen was not going to work for me, knowing I would be working from home for an extended period of time. This was easy to install and works very well. I can see my spreadsheets again!
customer_reviews.author: carolsioux

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a monitor ASAP and this arrived so fast! Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: great monitor made by a top company a second one is in the future!!!
customer_reviews.text: this monitor still looks amazing despite it coming out in 2011(i think). i did have to turn down the brightness to 50 though it was at max by default. the stand only has wobble when you touch the buttons even while i type out this review i dont notice it. so heres my pros and cons pros great color :-) easy to switch between inputs :-) headphone jack hdmi for consoles cable boxes and whatever else :) vga input for my dreamcast :-) nice matte finish looks very slick :-) makes me wanna buy a second :-) cons ahh yes cons let me get to that wait i just remembered something i have none :-p
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has been a definite improvement for me. My previous monitor was adequate, but I had a great deal of difficulty reading text with it when the text was small or had a thin font. This monitor's text is very legible for my eyes and the colors a rich and well saturated. I don't notice any unevenness anywhere on the screen. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the quality of the monitor and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stan L. Riggin

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item from Amazon, but it was DOA. No sign of life when connected to power. No power LED or splash screen. I tried another power cable and different electric outlets, but it was dead. I sent it back and got another one, and the same thing happened! The second one was also DoA - same scenario. Absolutely no sign of life when connected to power. WTF is going on here? I'm not some kind of neophyte who doesn't know how to plug something in. Something is seriously wrong at ASUS if significant numbers of monitors are being sent out like this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Berks

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels...
customer_reviews.text: I bought without realizing it didn't have a displayport input, but it's a decent screen for the price, both of the screens I purchased had at least a couple dead pixels so that's a little annoying. If I was using them for something more than just work I would probably return and get something different but for the price they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: musikcandi

customer_reviews.title: Money better spent on newer monitor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased VS 248: The HDMI port on the one i received was dead. But, because this monitor is out of production and a 9 year old model at this point, you are better off spending the money on a newer monitor. I regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sreif78

customer_reviews.title: Different colors on different screens
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these, about a couple months (maybe 7 months) apart and they were completely two different colors. One was blueish and one was yellowish. i was really disappointed only because i was using them as dual screens and looking at them side by side they are 2 completely different shades! i even swapped the plugs to see if it was my videocard and it wasnt. returned the newer one and received another, same color. i had to manually try to adjust both so they could match. Really annoying. Anyway, it still has great color and detail as individual screens. Next time i would buy screens together at the same time to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Good - for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the assumption that quality computer hardware is heavy: I was concerned as I took it out of the box and realized that it didn't weigh that much. Surprisingly, it performed well. Good picture - digging the color and lack of ghosting (experience with my older monitor). No windows driver installation was required to use this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: The Midnight Green

customer_reviews.title: The Hissing monitor
customer_reviews.text: Hissing noise that comes from the audio output jack of this monitor. Asus "support" is a terrible joke. They won't even honor their "Rapid Replacement". First Asus product I've purchased and will be my last. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality, easy to setup, sturdy, for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item on April 21, 2014. I like the adjustable stand. The cabling provided a HDMI and normal pin type. All cable slid into their slots easily and didn't jiggle or feel loose. Resolution is perfect, this is a great monitor with clear Image quality. It has an easy menu layout for configuring your desired settings! Love the color reproduction on this monitor and the and the 2ms response time is really good. Also No dead pixels! Still no dead pixels and the Monitor is working perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Fellow

customer_reviews.title: Quality purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because i wanted a similar monitor to my VG248QE i bought a few years back and it works wonderfully right next to the old monitor! There are several slight Color differences but I'd expect that from the difference of price! Either way 5/5 wonderful purchase. (Picture shows monitor on left VG248QE on right)
customer_reviews.author: DK-Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for our company inventory day. I like them as they have good picture quality and they have HDMI+DVI+VGA which gives me a lot of flexibility to use them for my users' desktops or docks.
customer_reviews.author: Nimgol

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good price and the perfect size for my use. I purchased two and have them sitting side by side on my desk. I use these for work and for home. With the multiple inputs I can easily switch between my work and home computers. Having dual monitors makes my job much easier. The picture quality is good for the work that I do, including using Office products and Photoshop. I also use the HDMI input for a Tivo Mini and the TV picture quality is good as well. Built-in speakers may have been handy but I connected the Tivo Mini to my PC speakers and the sound is probably better than any built-in speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: HDMI port does not work
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the HDMI cable and tried to connect to the laptop and it did not work at all. I tried the same HDMI cable on a ACER monitor I just bought and it worked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor on a daily basis and I am very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old HP monitor that finally bit the dust, and am very happy that I went with this one. The size is great, and unlike some, I didn't have to do any adjusting right out of the box (guess I got lucky). I've watched movies and played computer games with this monitor, and the response time is really good, very smooth motion. I really like the slim design, and while it does feel flimsy (as some reviewers have stated) and does wobble a bit, it has held up well through numerous uses, both by me and my grandchildren, and don't see there being any problems. All in all, I'm very happy with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: G. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor, but can't they make one with an adjustable stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar model 2 yrs ago, but really there is very little difference. The monitor works great and is easy to set up. The colors are just right with just some minor tweaks. Yes, you can buy better monitors, but you'll be paying much more. For most typical users a monitor like this will work just fine. The only thing I don't like about this monitor is the stand. Not that it's wobbly like others have mentioned, I think it sits too low and there is no way to adjust it higher. So I ended up buying a 4" monitor shelf/stand separately which took care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: mabinmaui

customer_reviews.title: Good job Asus
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing. Right out of the box, the picture was spot on. I rummaged around the controls just to see what was offered and found even more amazing features. I settled on Theatre mode although I could have left it right where it was. The 24" size sure makes a difference from the 23.6" size. It just fit into my computer desk. Asus always makes good products. I have a laptop made by them that is also amazing. Well... before I get too chatty, I just want to say you can't go wrong with this monitor
customer_reviews.author: Pogostyx

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: Received this in less than 24 hrs and item arrived nicely packed and in perfect condition. I hooked monitor up right away and was blown away at how sharp and vivid the display images were. I watched several test videos and trailers to test quality and was further amazed at the video quality of this monitor. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase and think this is an excellent monitor at a very good price for my home office use.
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this monitor. The picture is perfect. Better than my Samsung that bit the dust. Have had it for 2 weeks now and no problems with it whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: JHM

customer_reviews.title: Immediate ghosting and flickering
customer_reviews.text: Within days I began noticing increasing ghosting. After a little bit of looking around I discovered that this is a common problem for this monitor that can sometimes be corrected by disabling OD. Doing so lessened but did not eliminate the problem. Within a week I began noticing a slight flickering. Having read about the numerous issues other customers have had with this monitor I decided to return it, not exchange it, and look for something more reliable. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone, it's sole purpose is to display things clearly and it is unable to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash the colors are way off don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is pure trash no two ways about it. The color saturation and contrast out of the box are completely off and even with hours of adjusting it, the best it can become is passable. Save yourself money and time and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Castanon

customer_reviews.title: ASUS.. enough said the brand is top notch!
customer_reviews.text: Second time I’ve purchased this monitor so I now have a dual monitor setup. I seriously love them! I use them more for work then gaming but the picture quality is awesome and the first one I’ve had for over a year with no issues with the new one right next to it I see no picture fade between the two.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Love it, wish it came with HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: Been running this monitor for about a month now and still loving it. I use the HDMI input and the clarity is excellent, all text is easy to read without adjust font size, this alone is a big improvement over my prior monitor. In all fairness the prior monitor was 10 years old and running on an analog input. Setup was super easy, only down side is that the HDMI cable is the only thing not included, not a big deal because a new cable is as cheap as six bucks, twelve if you want a serious one. All other cables are included. And the couple extra inches in size does make a solid difference. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price nor the time to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Thought this monitor looked cheaply made right out of the box. But when I tried it, there was no doubt...cheaply made. Color is off, brightness a joke, and the scrolling lag infuriatingly slow. So back into the box and back to Amazon it went.
customer_reviews.author: ParisLawrence

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Monitor arrived in seemingly good condition; the box wasn't beat up, and the monitor and all the components had no scratches or dents. However, once I hooked everything up to my computer, the monitor refused to turn on. I tried all the different video cables and a spare power cable, but nothing worked. My guess is I'm just one of the few unlucky people that got a defect, but it's still irritating none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. I am using it paired to a 25" Hanns-G monitor on a dual-monitor set-up. Picture is crisp and clear and bright. Adjustments are pretty standard, and I managed to get it and the Hanns-G close enough that it is virtually impossible to see any difference between the pictures. I have used Asus gear before and have no complaints about it. For the price, this is one of the most capable monitors in its class. I like that it has understated light indicators, too - too many of the newer gen have way too many or too bright power or mode lights. Keep it simple, ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice picture
customer_reviews.text: Great picture at a fair price. Very happy with this monitor. Update 11/24/17 I ordered a second one not quite a year later and the new one I just received has a much richer color, a little disappointed that the first one wasn't as nice. My advice order your monitors together so they will match, and on my first one a blue dot appears and disappears but overall I wont change my 5 star because I do like them even they don't match.
customer_reviews.author: smilebrightrado

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, excellent price. Most pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected in terms of size, resolution, and sound. Not a fancy monitor, but a great deal. I use it for work, because it allows me to display two documents blown up to the size of a letter page side by side. I also use it to watch high-definition videos and for computer gaming. The monitor is, of course, plug-and-play. Note the availability of various ports as listed in the product description by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Useless if you own an HP Envy unless you want to invest in a $75 connection as well. Save yourself a LOT of frustration and wasted time and just toss $130 out the window.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Long term, what you may want to know?
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for two years and have not had any major complications. Every now and then, my LED back light will begin to present color strangely. This means that my webpages, videos, and pictures can still be viewed, but not in the original color. When this happens, I power off the monitor and power it back on. Then, my colors return to the original. I may have done this four times in the last two years. All in all, I still believe this is a good buy and perhaps it may be a part of the Blue Light Reduction feature on this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Patrick Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. Hard to calibrate, apples to apples
customer_reviews.text: Can confirm what others have said: It's clearly not always the same panel inside, just seems to be the same dimensions and housing. I was somewhat disappointed. I this same model from 4 years ago. The new one I just ordered is sitting next to the old one. I've done some color calibration, but the new one just doesn't look like the old one. I actually prefer the old one. I might return this and just get something larger. By itself, if you're not nitpicking it against another monitor like I am, it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: 🐱 Cat Slack Attack 🚀

customer_reviews.title: Doing just fine for my new work at home life
customer_reviews.text: It works fine with email and spreadsheets. It replaces a 7 year old screen, and the picture, brightness, etc, are much improved. Can't comment on gaming.
customer_reviews.author: TL6

customer_reviews.title: - Excellent image - Excellent price - Almost no heat output ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Excellent image - Excellent price - Almost no heat output - Low power usage. - All 3 major inputs included: HDMI, DVI and VGA. Cons: - Vertical viewing angle not that great. I have to adjust the angle every time I sit up or lean back in my chair to prevent the top or bottom from being too dark or bleached out. - All factory preset image settings are way too bright, even in my well-lit home office. I had to use manual mode to save my retinas. Alternately, use sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mazzeo

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a fair price. My wife's desktop monitor died. The monitor itself was OK, but the power supply was intermittent. So I checked with my son who is an IT manager for a large government agency and he recommended ASUS monitors. Reviews were great for this model so I bought it. Easy to set up with on screen prompts and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Sacramena Kid

customer_reviews.title: Not flexible
customer_reviews.text: The base is fixed, and I cannot adjust the height. And I cannot change the imput port without connecting to a laptop. For example, I am connecting to laptop to it using a HDML cable. But the default setting is VGA. So I need to find a HDML to VGA adapter to connect to the VGA input port in order to change the input to HDML. But for just a little bit over 100 dollars, this is still a good buy
customer_reviews.author: South SJer

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: first off I would not recommend this model for a primary monitor but saying that if you want a 2nd monitor or triple buying a pair of these for a low budget quick shipping i feel you cant beat its price point...i have had no issues besides the brightness is noticeably darker than my other high end 144hrz asus monitor and whites are also not a true white its sort of yellow haze...like I said above gret for 2nd monitor not so great for a primary
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Own 3, would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.text: These monitors are good for a decent setup. I have three of these sitting on an Ergotech arm and they look good. I personally like to have all the same monitors, and these did the trick. They are not too expensive, nor are they extremely cheap. Be wary though, these screens will tear if you are running games at over 60FPS. I have to 980ti's in my computer and that is way overkill. A simple GTX 970 will do these monitors wonders
customer_reviews.author: A Webb

customer_reviews.title: New life for my laptop as a desktop replacement
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer. I just need more screen size and this monitor does the trick. Multiple connectivity. Not a bad image for the price. It meets my every need.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the computer in the spare bedroom...otherwise buyer beware...
customer_reviews.text: I hate leaving poor reviews...I really do. So much for viewing angle and any modicum of color value. I was very excited to receive two VS248H-P monitors yesterday. After removing the stands and installing the VESA hardware i had the perfect triple monitor setup...not! Take the overwhelmingly positive reviews of this item with a grain of salt. Massive color shift in two out of two units even when viewed dead-on. In a multiple monitor set-up like mine it's just maddening. The images tell the story. TL;DR If you are buying a monitor for the computer in the spare bedroom, it'll do...maybe. ASUS is there anything I can do here...I'd really like to avoid the time wasting dismantling process?
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great monitors!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered three of these to create a surround of mounted monitor. I've not had any color issues with these monitors and currently have them all mounted on a stand. This monitor is VERSA mountable and come with platforms. The platforms are optional on the monitors although the stands do not come off. Also, these monitors do not have sound functionality which means you'll have to buy speakers separately. I would recommend these monitors to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Devvin C.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a standard computer monitor, this one is a good buy at a decent price. It's not for anyone wanting top shelf visuals or super speedy blur-free gaming. But for everyday typical computer use, it is worth the price for sure. Delivery was quick too.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you like scrolling lines through your games and applications.
customer_reviews.text: The colors were decent but you can see weird scrolling lines when the monitor is on the entire time. Changing the resolution does not help,
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dimetres

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give this 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I absolutely love this monitor. I use it for photo editing and gaming. It's actually so great that I was about to order another one when I realized that Acer never sent my rebate. I competed all of the paperwork and mailed everything in within 30 days of my purchase and they never contacted me. I plan on calling Monday morning to try and clear it all up but until their customer service dept comes through on their end of the deal I can't give this a positive rating. It's unfortunate because the product is very good.
customer_reviews.author: MeCaL

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this monitor because of that but other than ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to use an old ATI video driver (version 8.87) and Catalyst Control Center (version 09.1) with Windows 8.1 to get it to expand to full screen. Using with ATI Radeon HD 4870 graphics card. Not happy with this monitor because of that but other than that the color and brightness is much better on this monitor than an older 24" using as a 2nd monitor. ASUS should offer a driver that works with Windows 8.1 and HD4870 card as I'm not the only one with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: JerryEl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: LCDs are always a tricky proposition. Dead pixels, broken bezels/stands etc. But this was good to go right out of the box and wow the light, color, brightness everything was 100% perfect. I either got "the good one" or they are all can't miss. More and more I'm learning to love everything Asus puts on the market. The only drawback is that the stand is a little low if you are going to put it on the same desk level as your keyboard. I found myself looking down until I just went ahead and purchased a wallmount (never thought I would do that for a PC monitor!) so if you have single level desk surface, this might need a tweak.
customer_reviews.author: m4h3r

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the monitor so far
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the monitor so far. Unless doing a detailed side by side viewing comparison, it's difficult to tell the difference between this and other monitors with similar specifications. Most user reviews seemed positive, however. Rebate offer is a little tricky in that it was rejected once due to the fact I sent in the Amazon ship verification. Needed to print out a copy of the receipt from Amazon instead. My fault. However, you only get one more chance after the initial submission to correct things. Still haven't received actual rebate, but I see that it's now been approved.
customer_reviews.author: dmaka

customer_reviews.title: With great pricing comes a lack of accountability
customer_reviews.text: First monitor I've tried after my two previous Dell U2412M monitors; have a nice, bright stuck pixel in the center of the monitor from the moment I plugged it in and the warranty says this is fine. Maybe that's supposed to be typical, but I'm unimpressed and will go back to my Dell monitors next time.
customer_reviews.author: N. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 24 Inch HD Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old 32" TV that I was using as a monitor. The monitor comes in proper packaging, and was very easy to assemble. No HDMI cord was included-I used the DVI cord that came with it. The display is crystal clear, and the response time is lightning quick-I've had no issues with ghosting while playing games. The monitor's footprint is small, and the bezel is a little under an inch on the edges, for those who are considering buying two of these for a dual monitor set up. All in all a great, good quality monitor. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: These are great looking and performing monitors for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking and performing monitors for the price. I have a professional level 16:10 Samsung at work, that is 2-3x the price, and there is barely a difference between the two. The monitor came very well packaged, with both DVI and VGA cables included, which is always a plus. The only improvement I could wish for is a more sturdy base... it's not like it's going to fall over, but it does seem to amplify any desk movement. This is the case with pretty much all 20"+ monitors these days though.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Martynov

customer_reviews.title: too bright - but otherwise a great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this monitor except for one thing - it's too bright. I usually lower my monitor's brightness to about 30-40% as I like a dim screen. However with this monitor lowered to 0% it was still too bright. Decreasing the contrast helped get it to an acceptable level. However, the non-glossy screen is amazing. I HATE how Apple and all these other companies think a glossy screen is "sexy". It's not, it's just annoying. So thank you ASUS for this monitor. And the size for the price is an amazing deal.
customer_reviews.author: ferret

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a year or so ago and went back for another. Good value, good quality, everything I need it to be. Came well packaged and with all the cables you'll need to connect it. I originally saw this used as the go-to screen in an esports tournament.
customer_reviews.author: Maldorath

customer_reviews.title: Peeeerfecr
customer_reviews.text: Way better quality than the monitor my sister just bought. I got this as a gift for my boyfriend because his was dying. This one looks better than his primary monitor and the settings seemed both easy and precise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeroyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor at a Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: This Monitor is Great! 100% Crystal clear and 0 Dead pixels or any other problems. I have owned this for a month now and it still is working great. I am running it off of DVI right now. I will be buying the second one today as the 20$ rebate they offer expires 10/31/2014. (I am still waiting on the first rebate, but that is normal. They did say up to 8 weeks). If you pay 2$ they will rush you the rebate. I have found ASUS products to be among the most reliable I have used. From their Motherboards to their monitors.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic looking Monitor @ great price
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in today. Setup was super easy and straight-forward. Picture is bright and crystal clear! Highly Recommend. Issue: One tiny red stuck pixel at the bottom right of the screen.... Feels like it's poking at me continually to annoy me. Will likely have to exchange. *Update 1/28: returned product via Amazon returns, so easy, quick and straight-forward. Thanks Amazon. Replacement was new product - no dead pixels - still great product. For the price, it's a fantastic monitor. Would prefer the 144hz version, but not for $100 more!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst...
customer_reviews.text: I got these on Black Friday at a pretty deep discount. They're ok. I don't feel like the graphics are as great as they could be. The color is a little washed out and they're not very crisp. My wife isn't as picky as me and will probably inherit them... I'm kind of sad because they were such a bargain. But then again there's the old saying "I can't afford to buy cheap tools"...
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget the rebate
customer_reviews.text: I just got my monitor and it is so bright I was almost shocked. Now I know what the difference is that everyone talking about the specs was referring to. It pays to do your homework before you buy, and this was a perfect example. A great value for the money. I also like the attention to customer service, as I called to find out about the warranty, and had no trouble quickly getting all the information I wanted (btw, it is a great warranty - 3 years parts and labor). Don't pass up looking for a rebate on the Asus rebate site. There is an April rebate for this model.
customer_reviews.author: madb51

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I needed to get a second monitor seeing the one I was using was an small drawing one. This one has the same specs as the one I got through the company I got my computer. Though the style of it is a little different than that one, it's still the same brand so all that matters. The settings on it makes it to where you can change it however you with especially if you have sensitive eyes!
customer_reviews.author: KhesaFae

customer_reviews.title: big huge not as sharp
customer_reviews.text: So I went from 2 17" monitors to 2 24" monitors thinking that I will have oodles of desk top space and watching movies will be great. Yep and those 2 are great. But the Explorer windows and Web pages all open huge! Far beyond the need to scroll. I'm sure there is a way to fix but not intuitive. Also, it looks as some of the characters are washed out. I think that it has to do with a somewhat large pixel size and small font. I should have stuck with 21" max.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great screen!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my needs working from home! Wish it came with an HDMI cable but good for the price! Was available when I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Silk

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I took a little time before pulling the trigger to buy a new monitor, in the end I had my choice narrowed down to this one and a viewsonic. I'm very pleased with this monitor, I do play some games and it performs great on everything I have thrown at it. I suppose if there is anything negative to say about the monitor is that I don't really care for the stand too much, would have preferred something a little more sturdy, this one tends to wobble if I am too aggressive playing a game or something but as far as the performance, picture and quality of the monitor itself, I can't find anything bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor
customer_reviews.text: One of the best monitors I've owned, and I've had a lot of them. The short and sweet is that the build quality is good, design is nice, and it was cheaper than others. The buttons are .. well.. buttons, I hate touch screen monitors where you have to tap some region to turn them on or off, they never work right ( Dell .. ahem! ).. It also has a good energy saving mechanism, unlike others... It was light and easy to mount on my monitor arm. ( Currently I am sporting two of these and two Dell S2440L )
customer_reviews.author: A. Pavelescu

customer_reviews.title: Bright, easy to adjust, just right!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Asus 24" HDMI monitor I've ordered in 10 years. The 1st one finally died from a warn power switch. Love the color, depth, real black back ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kassey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect clarity, color and depth
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 20" monitor with unit. Call me silly but I was expecting it to be bigger as it seemed like a very modest upgrade from my 20". That being said this bad boy showed up in ready to go fashion and with a flawless picture. Due to my miscalculation I upgraded to the AOC E2752VH. That monitor took a bit of tweaking to get right and I still feel the ASUS had better color. If I had to complain about anything it would be a stand with limited adjustability which is common with all monitors. Two of these bad boys would be the ultimate dual monitor set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are all but useless
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have some knowledge about monitors, the instructions are all but useless. The monitor “wobbles”, as others have noted. Other than that, it seems to be a good monitor at a decent price, we or I will see.
customer_reviews.author: RodNet B

product_meta.title: ASUS VS248H-P 24" Full HD 1920x1080 2ms HDMI DVI VGA Back-lit LED Monitor
product_meta.description:
ASUS VS248H-P 24" Full HD 1920x1080 2ms HDMI DVI-D VGA Back-lit LED monitor

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




PRODUCTIVITY CLASS VS SERIES SLIM LED MONITORS
MAKE WHAT YOU SEE, AMAZING


If you're looking for some serious business monitors, then get a monitor that's made for it. VS series monitors are built from the ground up to be used in the office environment with embedded power adapters into the design while still remaining slim and stylish. For added convenience, these monitors are VESA compatible, so you can neatly place it on a wall. VS monitors deliver Full HD quality visuals and are LED backlit delivering brighter displays than non-LED backlit monitors. With an ultra-fast 2ms response time, enjoy smooth motion playback for videos and movies. The first monitors to be featured in the renowned Corporate Stable Model (CSM) program, VS monitors are guaranteed in stable supply for a minimum of one year so you can order the same model without worry of it being discontinued and, with the included advanced swap replacement service, saving you time should the unit require servicing. These monitors are EPEAT Gold and ENERGY STAR certified to reduce environmental impact and save on energy costs. 



LEARN MORE
ASUS SMART CONTRAST RATIO


View larger 

ASUS Smart Contrast Ratio (ASCR) is a dynamic contrast ratio that measures how dark a screen can get. With high dynamic contrast ratios of 50,000,000:1, ASCR delivers a more defined image especially while watching night scenes in movies, playing games, or giving presentations. 



SPLENDID VIDEO INTELLIGENCE TECHNOLOGY


View larger 

ASUS Splendid Video Intelligence Technology, or Splendid for short, is a quick image setting selectable through buttons on the monitor. Featuring different scenario settings ranging from game to scenario modes, choose your preferred one for your task at hand. 



ADVANCED CONNECTIVITY


View larger 

Featuring the latest in display technology, connect to your devices with an assortment of options. More inputs give you more options for customizing your PC setup like setting up multiple displays. HDMI connectivity delivers both high-definition audio and video in one streamlined cord to external monitors, projectors, and compatible TVs.



ASUS MONITOR SERIES
*Select Models



KEY FEATURES
 * Full HD displays for amazing high-definition visual clarity (Learn more)
 * 2ms response times for smooth motion playback 
 * LED backlit for energy-efficient operation and brighter luminance
 * Built-in power adapters for space-saving yet still slim design
 * 50,000,000:1 ASUS Smart Contrast Ratio for more defined images in dark colors (Learn more)
 * Advanced connectivity for convenient ways to connect your PCs and notebooks (Learn more)
 * Splendid Video Intelligence Technology quick image presets for your preferred task at hand (Learn more)
 * Corporate Stable Model certified for one year guaranteed supply (Learn more)
 * ASUS Rapid Replacement service for quick product replacement should a unit be sent for repair (Learn more)

RELAX, WE GOT YOU COVERED


Should something happen to your ASUS monitor, rest assured, you're covered with a 3-year system and panel warranty to protect it from the unfortunate. For even greater convenience, one-of-a-kind ASUS Rapid Replacement cross-shipping sends you a replacement unit as soon as the defective unit is in the mail—shortening your waiting time.
